intro: Sorghum nutans subsp. scaberrimum, commonly known as the rough sorghum, is a member of the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its tall, robust stalks and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and produces panicles of small, two-lipped flowers. Its leaves are covered in coarse, rough hairs, which give it its common name. This subspecies is adapted to dry and disturbed environments, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
